intro: Galeopsis parviflora, commonly known as lesser hedge-nettle, is an annual herbaceous plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm and features opposite, hairy leaves that are lance-shaped with serrated edges. The plant produces small, pale blue to purple flowers arranged in whorled clusters, which bloom from June to August. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in fields, roadsides, and waste areas. Galeopsis parviflora is also known for its medicinal properties, traditionally used to treat skin irritations and respiratory issues.
